text: ਸਲੋਕ ਮਹਲਾ ੩

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Do not call the wandering beggars holy men, if their minds are filled with doubt.

transliteration.text: abhiāgat ēh n ākhīah jin kai man mah bharam .

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਤਿਨ ਕੇ ਦਿਤੇ ਨਾਨਕਾ ਤੇਹੋ ਜੇਹਾ ਧਰਮੁ ॥੧॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Whoever gives to them, O Nanak, earns the same sort of merit. ||1||

transliteration.text: tin kē ditē nānakā tēhō jēhā dharam .1.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: One who begs for the supreme status of the Fearless and Immaculate Lord

translation.text: - how rare are those who have the opportunity, O Nanak, to give food to such a person. ||2||

transliteration.text: tis kā bhōjan nānakā viralā pāē kōi .2.

translation.text: I could be famous throughout the nine regions of the earth, for my wisdom and thoughtful contemplation. ||3||

translation.text: If a Brahmin kills a cow or a female infant, and accepts the offerings of an evil person,

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: he is cursed with the leprosy of curses and criticism; he is forever and ever filled with egotistical pride.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: One who forgets the Naam, O Nanak, is covered by countless sins.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Let all wisdom be burnt away, except for the essence of spiritual wisdom. ||4||

transliteration.text: sabh budhī jālīah ik rahai tat giān .4.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: No one can erase that primal destiny written upon one's forehead.

transliteration.text: māthai jō dhur likhiā s mēt n sakai kōi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, whatever is written there, comes to pass. He alone understands, who is blessed by God's Grace. ||5||

transliteration.text: nānak jō likhiā sō varatadā sō būjhai jis nō nadar hōi .5.

translation.text: Those who forget the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and become attached to greed and fraud,

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: are engrossed in the entanglements of Maya the enticer, with the fire of desire within them.

transliteration.text: dhandhā māiā mōhanī antar tisanā ag .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who, like the pumpkin vine, are too stubborn climb the trellis, are cheated by Maya the cheater.

transliteration.text: jinhā vēl n tūnbarī māiā thagē thag .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs are bound and gagged and led away; the dogs do not join the herd of cows.

transliteration.text: manamukh bannh chalāīah nā milahī vag sag .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Lord Himself misleads the misguided ones, and He Himself unites them in His Union.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the Gurmukhs are saved; they walk in harmony with the Will of the True Guru. ||6||

transliteration.text: nānak guramukh shutīai jē chalai satigur bhāi .6.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: I praise the Praiseworthy Lord, and sing the Praises of the True Lord.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the One Lord alone is True; stay away from all other doors. ||7||

translation.text: O Nanak, wherever I go, I find the True Lord.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Wherever I look, I see the One Lord. He reveals Himself to the Gurmukh. ||8||

translation.text: The Word of the Shabad is the Dispeller of sorrow, if one enshrines it in the mind.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਤੇ ਮਨਿ ਵਸੈ ਕਰਮ ਪਰਾਪਤਿ ਹੋਇ ॥੯॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, it dwells in the mind; by God's Mercy, it is obtained. ||9||

translation.text: O Nanak, other empires are false; they alone are true emperors, who are imbued with the Naam. ||11||

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਨਾਮਹੀਨ ਨਕਟੇ ਫਿਰਹਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਨਾਵੈ ਬਹਿ ਰੋਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who lack the Naam wander around lost, with their noses cut off; without the Name, they sit and cry.

transliteration.text: nāmahīn nakatē phirah bin nāvai bah rōi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, no one can erase that which is pre-ordained by the Creator Lord. ||14||

transliteration.text: nānak jō dhur karatai likhiā s mēt n sakai kōi .14.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Gurmukhs earn the wealth of the Lord, contemplating the Word of the Guru's Shabad.

transliteration.text: guramukhā har dhan khatiā gur kai sabad vīchār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They receive the wealth of the Naam; their treasures are overflowing.

transliteration.text: nām padārath pāiā atut bharē bhandār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Through the Word of the Guru's Bani, they utter the Glorious Praises of the Lord, whose end and limitations cannot be found.

transliteration.text: har gun bānī ucharah ant n pārāvār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the Creator is the Doer of all; the Creator Lord beholds all. ||15||

transliteration.text: nānak sabh kāran karatā karai vēkhai sirajanahār .15.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Within the Gurmukh is intuitive peace and poise; his mind ascends to the Tenth Plane of the Akaashic Ethers.

transliteration.text: guramukh antar sahaj hai man chariā dasavai ākās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: No one is sleepy or hungry there; they dwell in the peace of the Ambrosial Name of the Lord.

transliteration.text: tithai ūnhgh n bhukh hai har anmrit nām sukh vās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, pain and pleasure do not afflict anyone, where the Light of the Lord, the Supreme Soul, illuminates. ||16||

transliteration.text: nānak dukh sukh viāpat nahī jithai ātam rām pragās .16.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: All have come, wearing the robes of sexual desire and anger.

transliteration.text: kām krōdh kā chōlarā sabh gal āē pāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Some are born, and some pass away. They come and go according to the Hukam of the Lord's Command.

transliteration.text: ik upajah ik binas jānhh hukamē āvai jāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Their comings and goings in reincarnation do not end; they are imbued with the love of duality.

transliteration.text: janman maran n chukaī rang lagā dūjai bhāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Bound in bondage, they are made to wander, and they cannot do anything about it. ||17||

transliteration.text: bandhan bandh bhavāīan karanā kashū n jāi .17.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those, upon whom the Lord showers His Mercy, come and meet the True Guru.

transliteration.text: jin kau kirapā dhārīan tinā satigur miliā āi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Meeting with the True Guru, they turn away from the world; they remain dead while still alive, with intuitive peace and poise.

transliteration.text: satigur milē ulatī bhaī mar jīviā sahaj subhāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the devotees are imbued with the Lord; they are absorbed in the Name of the Lord. ||18||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The intellect of the self-willed manmukh is fickle; he is very tricky and clever within.

transliteration.text: manamukh chanchal mat hai antar bahut chaturāī .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Whatever he has done, and all that he does, is useless. Not even an iota of it is acceptable.

transliteration.text: kītā karatiā birathā gaiā ik til thāi n pāī .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The charity and generosity he pretends to give will be judged by the Righteous Judge of Dharma.

transliteration.text: punn dān jō bījadē sabh dharam rāi kai jāī .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Without the True Guru, the Messenger of Death does not leave the mortal alone; he is ruined by the love of duality.

transliteration.text: bin satigurū jamakāl n shōdaī dūjai bhāi khuāī .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Youth slips away imperceptibly, old age comes, and then he dies.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The mortal is caught in love and emotional attachment to children and spouse, but none of them will be his helper and support in the end.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Whoever serves the True Guru finds peace; the Name comes to abide in the mind.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਸੇ ਵਡੇ ਵਡਭਾਗੀ ਜਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਸਮਾਈ ॥੧੯॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, great and very fortunate are those who, as Gurmukh, are absorbed in the Naam. ||19||

transliteration.text: nānak sē vadē vadabhāgī j guramukh nām samāī .19.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs do not even think of the Name; without the Name, they cry in pain.

transliteration.text: manamukh nām n chētanī bin nāvai dukh rōi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They do not worship the Lord, the Supreme Soul; how can they find peace in duality?

transliteration.text: ātamā rām n pūjanī dūjai kiu sukh hōi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They are filled with the filth of egotism; they do not wash it away with the Word of the Shabad.

transliteration.text: haumai antar mail hai sabad n kādhah dhōi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, without the Name, they die in their filth; they waste the priceless opportunity of this human life. ||20||

transliteration.text: nānak bin nāvai mailiā muē janam padārath khōi .20.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs are deaf and blind; they are filled with the fire of desire.

transliteration.text: manamukh bōlē andhulē tis mah aganī kā vās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਬਾਣੀ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਨ ਬੁਝਨੀ ਸਬਦਿ ਨ ਕਰਹਿ ਪ੍ਰਗਾਸੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They have no intuitive understanding of the Guru's Bani; they are not illumined with the Shabad.

transliteration.text: bānī surat n bujhanī sabad n karah pragās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਓਨਾ ਆਪਣੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸੁਧਿ ਨਹੀ ਗੁਰ ਬਚਨਿ ਨ ਕਰਹਿ ਵਿਸਾਸੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They do not know their own inner being, and they have no faith in the Guru's Word.

transliteration.text: ōnā āpanī andar sudh nahī gur bachan n karah visās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਗਿਆਨੀਆ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਹੈ ਨਿਤ ਹਰਿ ਲਿਵ ਸਦਾ ਵਿਗਾਸੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Word of the Guru's Shabad is within the being of the spiritually wise ones. They always blossom in His love.

transliteration.text: giānīā andar gur sabad hai nit har liv sadā vigās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਹਰਿ ਗਿਆਨੀਆ ਕੀ ਰਖਦਾ ਹਉ ਸਦ ਬਲਿਹਾਰੀ ਤਾਸੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Lord saves the honor of the spiritually wise ones.I am forever a sacrifice to them.

transliteration.text: har giānīā kī rakhadā hau sad balihārī tās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜੋ ਹਰਿ ਸੇਵਦੇ ਜਨ ਨਾਨਕੁ ਤਾ ਕਾ ਦਾਸੁ ॥੨੧॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Servant Nanak is the slave of those Gurmukhs who serve the Lord. ||21||

transliteration.text: guramukh jō har sēvadē jan nānak tā kā dās .21.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਮਾਇਆ ਭੁਇਅੰਗਮੁ ਸਰਪੁ ਹੈ ਜਗੁ ਘੇਰਿਆ ਬਿਖੁ ਮਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The poisonous snake, the serpent of Maya, has surrounded the world with its coils, O mother!

transliteration.text: māiā bhuiangam sarap hai jag ghēriā bikh māi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਬਿਖੁ ਕਾ ਮਾਰਣੁ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰ ਗਰੁੜ ਸਬਦੁ ਮੁਖਿ ਪਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The antidote to this poisonous venom is the Name of the Lord; the Guru places the magic spell of the Shabad into the mouth.

transliteration.text: bikh kā māran har nām hai gur garur sabad mukh pāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who are blessed with such pre-ordained destiny come and meet the True Guru.

transliteration.text: jin kau pūrab likhiā tin satigur miliā āi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Meeting with the True Guru, they become immaculate, and the poison of egotism is eradicated.

transliteration.text: mil satigur niramal hōiā bikh haumai gaiā bilāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Radiant and bright are the faces of the Gurmukhs; they are honored in the Court of the Lord.

transliteration.text: guramukhā kē mukh ujalē har daragah sōbhā pāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Servant Nanak is forever a sacrifice to those who walk in harmony with the Will of the True Guru. ||22||

transliteration.text: jan nānak sadā kurabān tin jō chālah satigur bhāi .22.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The True Guru, the Primal Being, has no hatred or vengeance. His heart is constantly attuned to the Lord.

transliteration.text: satigur purakh niravair hai nit hiradai har liv lāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Whoever directs hatred against the Guru, who has no hatred at all, only sets his own home on fire.

transliteration.text: niravairai nāl vair rachāidā apanai ghar lūkī lāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਕ੍ਰੋਧੁ ਅਹੰਕਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਅਨਦਿਨੁ ਜਲੈ ਸਦਾ ਦੁਖੁ ਪਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Anger and egotism are within him night and day; he burns, and suffers constant pain.

transliteration.text: antar krōdh ahankār hai anadin jalai sadā dukh pāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਕੂੜੁ ਬੋਲਿ ਬੋਲਿ ਨਿਤ ਭਉਕਦੇ ਬਿਖੁ ਖਾਧੇ ਦੂਜੈ ਭਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They babble and tell lies, and keep on barking, eating the poison of the love of duality.

transliteration.text: kūr bōl bōl nit bhaukadē bikh khādhē dūjai bhāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਬਿਖੁ ਮਾਇਆ ਕਾਰਣਿ ਭਰਮਦੇ ਫਿਰਿ ਘਰਿ ਘਰਿ ਪਤਿ ਗਵਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: For the sake of the poison of Maya, they wander from house to house, and lose their honor.

transliteration.text: bikh māiā kāran bharamadē phir ghar ghar pat gavāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਬੇਸੁਆ ਕੇਰੇ ਪੂਤ ਜਿਉ ਪਿਤਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਤਿਸੁ ਜਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They are like the son of a prostitute, who does not know the name of his father.

transliteration.text: bēsuā kērē pūt jiu pitā nām tis jāi .

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They do not remember the Name of the Lord, Har, Har; the Creator Himself brings them to ruin.

transliteration.text: har har nām n chētanī karatai āp khuāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Servant Nanak is a sacrifice to those who fall at the Feet of the True Guru. ||23||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who are attached to the Naam, the Name of the Lord, are saved; without the Name, they must go to the City of Death.

transliteration.text: nām lagē sē ūbarē bin nāvai jam pur jānhh .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: When anxiety and wanderings come to an end, the mind becomes happy.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, the soul-bride understands, and then she sleeps without worry.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who have such pre-ordained destiny meet with the Guru, the Lord of the Universe.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, they merge intuitively into the Lord, the Embodiment of Supreme Bliss. ||25||

translation.text: Those who serve their True Guru, who contemplate the Word of the Guru's Shabad,

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The True Name is their merchandise, the True Name is their expenditure; the Love of their Beloved fills their inner beings.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Messenger of Death does not even approach them; the Creator Lord Himself forgives them.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਵਡਭਾਗੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਬੂਝਿਆ ਬ੍ਰਹਮੁ ਬਿਚਾਰੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: By great good fortune, one meets the True Guru, and comes to understand the contemplation of God.

transliteration.text: vadabhāgī satigur pāiā būjhiā braham bichār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਤਿਸਨਾ ਅਗਨਿ ਸਭ ਬੁਝਿ ਗਈ ਜਨ ਨਾਨਕ ਹਰਿ ਉਰਿ ਧਾਰਿ ॥੨੮॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The fire of desire is totally extinguished, O servant Nanak, enshrining the Lord within the heart. ||28||

transliteration.text: tisanā agan sabh bujh gaī jan nānak har ur dhār .28.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: I make so many mistakes, there is no end or limit to them.

transliteration.text: asī khatē bahut kamāvadē ant n pārāvār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਹਰਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਕਰਿ ਕੈ ਬਖਸਿ ਲੈਹੁ ਹਉ ਪਾਪੀ ਵਡ ਗੁਨਹਗਾਰੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Lord, please be merciful and forgive me; I am a sinner, a great offender.

transliteration.text: har kirapā kar kai bakhas laih hau pāpī vad gunahagār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਹਰਿ ਜੀਉ ਲੇਖੈ ਵਾਰ ਨ ਆਵਈ ਤੂੰ ਬਖਸਿ ਮਿਲਾਵਣਹਾਰੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Dear Lord, if You made an account of my mistakes, my turn to be forgiven would not even come. Please forgive me, and unite me with Yourself.

transliteration.text: har jīu lēkhai vār n āvaī tūn bakhas milāvanahār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਗੁਰ ਤੁਠੈ ਹਰਿ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਮੇਲਿਆ ਸਭ ਕਿਲਵਿਖ ਕਟਿ ਵਿਕਾਰ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Guru, in His Pleasure, has united me with the Lord God; He has cut away all my sinful mistakes.

transliteration.text: gur tuthai har prabh mēliā sabh kilavikh kat vikār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Servant Nanak celebrates the victory of those who meditate on the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. ||29||

transliteration.text: jinā har har nām dhiāiā jan nānak tinh jaikār .29.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਵਿਛੁੜਿ ਵਿਛੁੜਿ ਜੋ ਮਿਲੇ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਕੇ ਭੈ ਭਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who have been separated and alienated from the Lord are united with Him again, through the Fear and the Love of the True Guru.

transliteration.text: vishur vishur jō milē satigur kē bhai bhāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਜਨਮ ਮਰਣ ਨਿਹਚਲੁ ਭਏ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਧਿਆਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They escape the cycle of birth and death, and, as Gurmukh, they meditate on the Naam, the Name of the Lord.

transliteration.text: janam maran nihachal bhaē guramukh nām dhiāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਗੁਰ ਸਾਧੂ ਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਹੀਰੇ ਰਤਨ ਲਭੰਨ੍ਹਿ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Joining the Saadh Sangat, the Guru's Congregation, the diamonds and jewels are obtained.

transliteration.text: gur sādhū sangat milai hīrē ratan labhannh .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the jewel is priceless; the Gurmukhs seek and find it. ||30||

transliteration.text: nānak lāl amōlakā guramukh khōj lahannh .30.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਚੇਤਿਓ ਧਿਗੁ ਜੀਵਣੁ ਧਿਗੁ ਵਾਸੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs do not even think of the Naam. Cursed are their lives, and cursed are their homes.

transliteration.text: manamukh nām n chētiō dhig jīvan dhig vās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਜਿਸ ਦਾ ਦਿਤਾ ਖਾਣਾ ਪੈਨਣਾ ਸੋ ਮਨਿ ਨ ਵਸਿਓ ਗੁਣਤਾਸੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: That Lord who gives them so much to eat and wear - they do not enshrine that Lord, the Treasure of Virtue, in their minds.

transliteration.text: jis dā ditā khānā painanā sō man n vasiō gunatās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਇਹੁ ਮਨੁ ਸਬਦਿ ਨ ਭੇਦਿਓ ਕਿਉ ਹੋਵੈ ਘਰ ਵਾਸੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: This mind is not pierced by the Word of the Shabad; how can it come to dwell in its true home?

transliteration.text: ih man sabad n bhēdiō kiu hōvai ghar vās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs are like discarded brides, ruined by coming and going in the cycle of reincarnation.

transliteration.text: manamukhīā dōhāganī āvan jān muīās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Gurmukhs are embellished and exalted by the Naam, the Name of the Lord; the jewel of destiny is engraved upon their foreheads.

transliteration.text: guramukh nām suhāg hai masatak manī likhiās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They enshrine the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, within their hearts; the Lord illumines their heart-lotus.

transliteration.text: har har nām ur dhāriā har hiradai kamal pragās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: I am forever a sacrifice to those who serve their True Guru.

transliteration.text: satigur sēvan āpanā hau sad balihārī tās .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, radiant and bright are the faces of those whose inner beings are illuminated with the Light of the Naam. ||31||

transliteration.text: nānak tin mukh ujalē jin antar nām pragās .31.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਸਬਦਿ ਮਰੈ ਸੋਈ ਜਨੁ ਸਿਝੈ ਬਿਨੁ ਸਬਦੈ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਨ ਹੋਈ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who die in the Word of the Shabad are saved. Without the Shabad, no one is liberated.

transliteration.text: sabad marai sōī jan sijhai bin sabadai mukat n hōī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਭੇਖ ਕਰਹਿ ਬਹੁ ਕਰਮ ਵਿਗੁਤੇ ਭਾਇ ਦੂਜੈ ਪਰਜ ਵਿਗੋਈ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They wear religious robes and perform all sorts of rituals, but they are ruined; in the love of duality, their world is ruined.

transliteration.text: bhēkh karah bah karam vigutē bhāi dūjai paraj vigōī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਬਿਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਨਾਉ ਨ ਪਾਈਐ ਜੇ ਸਉ ਲੋਚੈ ਕੋਈ ॥੩੨॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, without the True Guru, the Name is not obtained, even though one may long for it hundreds of times. ||32||

transliteration.text: nānak bin satigur nāu n pāīai jē sau lōchai kōī .32.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਹਰਿ ਕਾ ਨਾਉ ਅਤਿ ਵਡ ਊਚਾ ਊਚੀ ਹੂ ਊਚਾ ਹੋਈ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Name of the Lord is utterly great, lofty and high, the highest of the high.

transliteration.text: har kā nāu at vad ūchā ūchī hū ūchā hōī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਅਪੜਿ ਕੋਇ ਨ ਸਕਈ ਜੇ ਸਉ ਲੋਚੈ ਕੋਈ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: No one can climb up to it, even though one may long for it, hundreds of times.

transliteration.text: apar kōi n sakaī jē sau lōchai kōī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Speaking about self-discipline, no one become pure; everyone walks around wearing religious robes.

transliteration.text: mukh sanjam hashā n hōvaī kar bhēkh bhavai sabh kōī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those blessed by the karma of good deeds go and climb the ladder of the Guru.

transliteration.text: gur kī paurī jāi charai karam parāpat hōī .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Lord comes and dwells within that one who contemplates the Word of the Guru's Shabad.

transliteration.text: antar āi vasai gur sabad vīchārai kōi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, when someone dies in the Word of the Shabad, the mind is pleased and appeased. True is the reputation of those who are true. ||33||

transliteration.text: nānak sabad marai man mānīai sāchē sāchī sōi .33.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Emotional attachment to Maya is a treacherous ocean of pain and poison, which cannot be crossed.

transliteration.text: māiā mōh dukh sāgar hai bikh dutar tariā n jāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਮੇਰਾ ਮੇਰਾ ਕਰਦੇ ਪਚਿ ਮੁਏ ਹਉਮੈ ਕਰਤ ਵਿਹਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Screaming, "Mine, mine!", they rot and die; they pass their lives in egotism.

transliteration.text: mērā mērā karadē pach muē haumai karat vihāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਮਨਮੁਖਾ ਉਰਵਾਰੁ ਨ ਪਾਰੁ ਹੈ ਅਧ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਹੇ ਲਪਟਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs are in limbo, neither on this side, nor the other; they are stuck in the middle.

transliteration.text: manamukhā uravār n pār hai adh vich rahē lapatāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਜੋ ਧੁਰਿ ਲਿਖਿਆ ਸੁ ਕਮਾਵਣਾ ਕਰਣਾ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਜਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They act as they are pre-destined; they cannot do anything else.

transliteration.text: jō dhur likhiā s kamāvanā karanā kashū n jāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Following the Guru's Teachings, the jewel of spiritual wisdom abides in the mind, and then God is easily seen in all.

transliteration.text: guramatī giān ratan man vasai sabh dēkhiā braham subhāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the very fortunate ones embark on the Boat of the True Guru; they are carried across the terrifying world-ocean. ||34||

transliteration.text: nānak satigur bōhithai vadabhāgī charai tē bhaujal pār langhāi .34.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Without the True Guru, there is no giver who can bestow the Support of the Lord's Name.

transliteration.text: bin satigur dātā kō nahī jō har nām dēi ādhār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, the Name comes to dwell in the mind; keep it enshrined in your heart.

transliteration.text: gur kirapā tē nāu man vasai sadā rahai ur dhār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The fire of desire is extinguished, and one finds satisfaction, through the Love of the Name of the Lord.

transliteration.text: tisanā bujhai tipat hōi har kai nāi piār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the Gurmukh finds the Lord, when He showers His Mercy. ||35||

transliteration.text: nānak guramukh pāīai har apanī kirapā dhār .35.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Without the Shabad, the world is so insane, that it cannot even be described.

transliteration.text: bin sabadai jagat baraliā kahanā kashū n jāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who are protected by the Lord are saved; they remain lovingly attuned to the Word of the Shabad.

transliteration.text: har rakhē sē ubarē sabad rahē liv lāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the Creator who made this making knows everything. ||36||

transliteration.text: nānak karatā sabh kish jānadā jin rakhī banat banāi .36.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Pandits, the religious scholars, have grown weary of making fire-offerings and sacrifices, making pilgrimages to all the sacred shrines, and reading the Puraanas.

transliteration.text: hōm jag sabh tīrathā parh pandit thakē purān .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: But they cannot get rid of the poison of emotional attachment to Maya; they continue to come and go in egotism.

transliteration.text: bikh māiā mōh n mitaī vich haumai āvan jān .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Meeting with the True Guru, one's filth is washed off, meditating on the Lord, the Primal Being, the All-knowing One.

transliteration.text: satigur miliai mal utarī har japiā purakh sujān .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Servant Nanak is forever a sacrifice to those who serve their Lord God. ||37||

transliteration.text: jinā har har prabh sēviā jan nānak sad kurabān .37.

text: ਮਾਇਆ ਮੋਹੁ ਬਹੁ ਚਿਤਵਦੇ ਬਹੁ ਆਸਾ ਲੋਭੁ ਵਿਕਾਰ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Mortals give great thought to Maya and emotional attachment; they harbor great hopes, in greed and corruption.

transliteration.text: māiā mōh bah chitavadē bah āsā lōbh vikār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਮਨਮੁਖਿ ਅਸਥਿਰੁ ਨਾ ਥੀਐ ਮਰਿ ਬਿਨਸਿ ਜਾਇ ਖਿਨ ਵਾਰ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs do not become steady and stable; they die and are gone in an instant.

transliteration.text: manamukh asathir nā thīai mar binas jāi khin vār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Only those who are blessed with great good fortune meet the True Guru, and leave behind their egotism and corruption.

transliteration.text: vad bhāg hōvai satigur milai haumai tajai vikār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Chanting the Name of the Lord, they find peace; servant Nanak contemplates the Word of the Shabad. ||38||

transliteration.text: har nāmā jap sukh pāiā jan nānak sabad vīchār .38.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Without the True Guru, there is no devotional worship, and no love of the Naam, the Name of the Lord.

transliteration.text: bin satigur bhagat n hōvaī nām n lagai piār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Servant Nanak worships and adores the Naam, with love and affection for the Guru. ||39||

transliteration.text: jan nānak nām arādhiā gur kai hēt piār .39.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Do not trust greedy people, if you can avoid doing so.

transliteration.text: lōbhī kā vēsāh n kījai jē kā pār vasāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: At the very last moment, they will deceive you there, where no one will be able to lend a helping hand.

transliteration.text: ant kāl tithai dhuhai jithai hath n pāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਸੇਤੀ ਸੰਗੁ ਕਰੇ ਮੁਹਿ ਕਾਲਖ ਦਾਗੁ ਲਗਾਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Whoever associates with the self-willed manmukhs, will have his face blackened and dirtied.

transliteration.text: manamukh sētī sang karē muh kālakh dāg lagāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Black are the faces of those greedy people; they lose their lives, and leave in disgrace.

transliteration.text: muh kālē tinh lōbhīānh jāsan janam gavāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Lord, let me join the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation; may the Name of the Lord God abide in my mind.

transliteration.text: satasangat har mēl prabh har nām vasai man āi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The filth and pollution of birth and death is washed away, O servant Nanak, singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||40||

transliteration.text: janam maran kī mal utarai jan nānak har gun gāi .40.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Whatever is pre-destined by the Lord God Creator, cannot be erased.

transliteration.text: dhur har prabh karatai likhiā s mētanā n jāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Body and soul are all His. The Sovereign Lord King cherishes all.

transliteration.text: jīu pind sabh tis dā pratipāl karē har rāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The gossipers and slanderers shall remain hungry and die, rolling in the dust; their hands cannot reach anywhere.

transliteration.text: chugal nindak bhukhē rul muē ēnā hath n kithāū pāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Outwardly, they do all the proper deeds, but they are hypocrites; in their minds and hearts, they practice deception and fraud.

transliteration.text: bāhar pākhand sabh karam karah man hiradai kapat kamāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Whatever is planted in the farm of the body, shall come and stand before them in the end.

transliteration.text: khēt sarīr jō bījīai sō ant khalōā āi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Nanak offers this prayer: O Lord God, please forgive me, and unite me with Yourself. ||41||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The mortal being does not understand the comings and goings of reincarnation; he does not see the Court of the Lord.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: He is wrapped up in emotional attachment and Maya, and within his being is the darkness of ignorance.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The sleeping person wakes, only when he is hit on the head by a heavy club.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, they themselves are saved, and all their relatives are carried across as well. ||42||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Whoever dies in the Word of the Shabad, is known to be truly dead.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukh dies; his life is wasted.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who do not remember the Name of the Lord, shall cry in pain in the end.

translation.text: O Nanak, whatever the Creator Lord does, comes to pass. ||43||

translation.text: The Gurmukhs never grow old; within them is intuitive understanding and spiritual wisdom.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They chant the Praises of the Lord, forever and ever; deep within, they intuitively meditate on the Lord.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਮੁਏ ਵਿਕਾਰ ਮਹਿ ਮਰਿ ਜੰਮਹਿ ਵਾਰੋ ਵਾਰ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs die in evil and corruption; they die and are reborn, again and again.

transliteration.text: manamukh muē vikār mah mar janmah vārō vār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They alone live, who join with the living; enshrine the Lord, the Lord of Life, within your heart.

transliteration.text: jīvadiā nō milai s jīvadē har jagajīvan ur dhār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: O Nanak, the Gurmukhs look beautiful in that Court of the True Lord. ||47||

translation.text: The Lord built the Harimandir, the Temple of the Lord; the Lord dwells within it.

transliteration.text: har mandar har sājiā har vasai jis nāl .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Following the Guru's Teachings, I have found the Lord; my emotional attachment to Maya has been burnt away.

transliteration.text: guramatī har pāiā māiā mōh parajāl .

translation.text: Countless things are in the Harimandir, the Temple of the Lord; contemplate the Naam, and the nine treasures will be yours.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Blessed is that happy soul-bride, O Nanak, who, as Gurmukh, seeks and finds the Lord.

transliteration.text: dhan bhagavantī nānakā jinā guramukh ladhā har bhāl .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: By great good fortune, one searches the temple of the body-fortress, and finds the Lord within the heart. ||48||

transliteration.text: vadabhāgī gar mandar khōjiā har hiradai pāiā nāl .48.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs wander lost in the ten directions, led by intense desire, greed and corruption.

transliteration.text: manamukh dah dis phir rahē at tisanā lōbh vikār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Their attachment to Maya does not cease; they die, only to be reborn, over and over again.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Serving the True Guru, peace is found; intense desire and corruption are discarded.

transliteration.text: satigur sēv sukh pāiā at tisanā taj vikār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The pains of death and birth are taken away; servant Nanak reflects upon the Word of the Shabad. ||49||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Meditate on the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, O mortal being, and you shall be honored in the Court of the Lord.

transliteration.text: har har nām dhiāi man har daragah pāvah mān .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: All your sins and terrible mistakes shall be taken away, and you shall be rid of your pride and egotism.

transliteration.text: kilavikh pāp sabh katīah haumai chukai gumān .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The heart-lotus of the Gurmukh blossoms forth, realizing God, the Soul of all.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: In Dhanaasaree, the soul-bride is known to be wealthy, O Siblings of Destiny, when she works for the True Guru.

transliteration.text: dhanāsarī dhanavantī jānīai bhāī jānh satigur kī kār kamāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: She surrenders her body, mind and soul, O Siblings of Destiny, and lives according to the Hukam of His Command.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: I sit where He wishes me to sit, O Siblings of Destiny; wherever He sends me, I go.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: There is no other wealth as great, O Siblings of Destiny; such is the greatness of the True Name.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: I sing forever the Glorious Praises of the True Lord; I shall remain with the True One forever.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: So wear the clothes of His Glorious Virtues and goodness, O Siblings of Destiny; eat and enjoy the flavor of your own honor.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: How can I praise Him, O Siblings of Destiny? I am a sacrifice to the Blessed Vision of His Darshan.

transliteration.text: tis kā kiā sālāhīai bhāī darasan kau bal jāi .

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Great is the Glorious Greatness of the True Guru, O Siblings of Destiny; if one is blessed with good karma, He is found.

transliteration.text: satigur vich vadīā vadiāīā bhāī karam milai tānh pāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Some do not know how to submit to the Hukam of His Command, O Siblings of Destiny; they wander around lost in the love of duality.

transliteration.text: ik hukam mann n jānanī bhāī dūjai bhāi phirāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They find no place of rest in the Sangat, O Siblings of Destiny; they find no place to sit.

transliteration.text: sangat dhōī nā milai bhāī baisan milai n thāu .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

transliteration.text: nānak hukam tinā manāisī bhāī jinā dhurē kamāiā nāu .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: I am a sacrifice to them, O Siblings of Destiny, I am forever a sacrifice to them. ||51||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those beards are true, which brush the feet of the True Guru.

transliteration.text: sē dārīānh sachīā j gur charanī lagannh .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Those who serve their Guru night and day, live in bliss, night and day.

transliteration.text: anadin sēvan gur āpanā anadin anad rahannh .

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਸੇ ਮੁਹ ਸੋਹਣੇ ਸਚੈ ਦਰਿ ਦਿਸੰਨ੍ਹਿ ॥੫੨॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, their faces appear beautiful in the Court of the True Lord. ||52||

transliteration.text: nānak sē muh sōhanē sachai dar disannh .52.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: True are the faces and true are the beards, of those who speak the Truth and live the Truth.

transliteration.text: mukh sachē sach dārīā sach bōlah sach kamāh .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The True Word of the Shabad abides in their minds; they are absorbed in the True Guru.

transliteration.text: sachā sabad man vasiā satigur mānhh samānhh .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: True is their capital, and true is their wealth; they are blessed with the ultimate status.

transliteration.text: sachī rāsī sach dhan utam padavī pānhh .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: They hear the Truth, they believe in the Truth; they act and work in the Truth.

transliteration.text: sach sunah sach mann lain sachī kār kamāh .

translation.text: They are given a place in the Court of the True Lord; they are absorbed in the True Lord.

transliteration.text: sachī daragah baisanā sachē māh samāh .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, without the True Guru, the True Lord is not found. The self-willed manmukhs leave, wandering around lost. ||53||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Meeting with the Guru, the cooling, soothing water is obtained, and all pain is taken away.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the Gurmukhs are peaceful and tranquil; they enshrine the Naam, the Name of the Lord, within their hearts. ||54||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O rainbird, chirp the True Name, and let yourself be attuned to the True Lord.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Remember the Shabad, and your thirst shall be relieved; surrender to the Will of the Lord.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: From water, everything is produced; without water, thirst is not quenched.

transliteration.text: jal hī tē sabh ūpajai bin jal piās n jāi .

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਹਰਿ ਜਲੁ ਜਿਨਿ ਪੀਆ ਤਿਸੁ ਭੂਖ ਨ ਲਾਗੈ ਆਇ ॥੫੫॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, whoever drinks in the Water of the Lord, shall never feel hunger again. ||55||

transliteration.text: nānak har jal jin pīā tis bhūkh n lāgai āi .55.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O rainbird, speak the Shabad, the True Word of God, with natural peace and poise.

transliteration.text: bābīhā tūn sahaj bōl sachai sabad subhāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Everything is with you; the True Guru will show you this.

transliteration.text: sabh kish tērai nāl hai satigur dīā dikhāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: So understand your own self, and meet your Beloved; His Grace shall rain down in torrents.

transliteration.text: āp pashānah prītam milai vuthā shahabar lāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Drop by drop, the Ambrosial Nectar rains down softly and gently; thirst and hunger are completely gone.

transliteration.text: jhim jhim anmrit varasadā tisanā bhukh sabh jāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Your cries and screams of anguish have ceased; your light shall merge into the Light.

transliteration.text: kūk pukār n hōvaī jōtī jōt milāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the happy soul-brides sleep in peace; they are absorbed in the True Name. ||56||

transliteration.text: nānak sukh savanh sōhāganī sachai nām samāi .56.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Primal Lord and Master has sent out the True Hukam of His Command.

transliteration.text: dhurah khasam bhējiā sachai hukam pathāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Indra mercifully sends forth the rain, which falls in torrents.

transliteration.text: ind varasai daiā kar gūrhī shahabar lāi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The body and mind of the rainbird are happy. only when the rain-drop falls into its mouth.

transliteration.text: bābīhē tan man sukh hōi jānh tat būnd muh pāi .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The corn grows high, wealth increases, and the earth is embellished with beauty.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Night and day, people worship the Lord with devotion, and are absorbed in the Word of the Guru's Shabad.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The True Lord Himself forgives them, and showering them with His Mercy, He leads them to walk in His Will.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O brides, sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, and be absorbed in the True Word of His Shabad.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Let the Fear of God be your decoration, and remain lovingly attuned to the True Lord.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the Naam abides in the mind, and the mortal is saved in the Court of the Lord. ||57||

translation.text: The rainbird wanders all over the earth, soaring high through the skies.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the season of spring comes to one who serves the True Guru.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਸਬਦੇ ਸਦਾ ਬਸੰਤੁ ਹੈ ਜਿਤੁ ਤਨੁ ਮਨੁ ਹਰਿਆ ਹੋਇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Word of the Shabad brings eternal spring; it rejuvenates the mind and body.

transliteration.text: sabadē sadā basant hai jit tan man hariā hōi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, do not forget the Naam, the Name of the Lord, which has created everyone. ||60||

transliteration.text: nānak nām n vīsarai jin siriā sabh kōi .60.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, it is the spring season, for those Gurmukhs, within whose minds the Lord abides.

transliteration.text: nānak tinā basant hai jinā guramukh vasiā man sōi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: When the Lord showers His Mercy, the mind and body blossom forth, and all the world turns green and lush. ||61||

transliteration.text: har vuthai man tan parapharai sabh jag hariā hōi .61.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: In the early hours of the morning, whose name should we chant?

transliteration.text: vadarai jhāl jhalunbhalai nāvarā laīai kis .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Chant the Name of the Transcendent Lord, who is All-powerful to create and destroy. ||62||

transliteration.text: nāu laīai paramēsarai bhannan gharan samarath .62.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Persian wheel also cries out, "Too! Too! You! You!", with sweet and sublime sounds.

transliteration.text: harahat bhī tūn tūn karah bōlah bhalī bān .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਸਾਹਿਬੁ ਸਦਾ ਹਦੂਰਿ ਹੈ ਕਿਆ ਉਚੀ ਕਰਹਿ ਪੁਕਾਰ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Our Lord and Master is always present; why do you cry out to Him in such a loud voice?

transliteration.text: sāhib sadā hadūr hai kiā uchī karah pukār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: I am a sacrifice to that Lord who created the world, and who loves it.

transliteration.text: jin jagat upāi har rang kīā tisai vitah kurabān .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਆਪੁ ਛੋਡਹਿ ਤਾਂ ਸਹੁ ਮਿਲੈ ਸਚਾ ਏਹੁ ਵੀਚਾਰੁ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Give up your selfishness, and then you shall meet your Husband Lord. Consider this Truth.

transliteration.text: āp shōdah tānh sah milai sachā ēh vīchār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Speaking in shallow egotism, no one understands the Ways of God.

transliteration.text: haumai phikā bōlanā bujh n sakā kār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The forests and fields, and all the three worlds meditate on You, O Lord; this is the way they pass their days and nights forever.

transliteration.text: van trin tribhavan tujhai dhiāidā anadin sadā vihān .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Without the True Guru, no one finds the Lord. People have grown weary of thinking about it.

transliteration.text: bin satigur kinai n pāiā kar kar thakē vīchār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: But if the Lord casts His Glance of Grace, then He Himself embellishes us.

transliteration.text: nadar karah jē āpanī tānh āpē laih savār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the Gurmukhs meditate on the Lord; blessed and approved is their coming into the world. ||63||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Yoga is not obtained by wearing saffron robes; Yoga is not obtained by wearing dirty robes.

transliteration.text: jōg n bhagavī kaparī jōg n mailē vēs .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, Yoga is obtained even while sitting in your own home, by following the Teachings of the True Guru. ||64||

transliteration.text: nānak ghar baithiā jōg pāīai satigur kai upadēs .64.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: You may wander in all four directions, and read the Vedas throughout the four ages.

transliteration.text: chārē kundā jē bhavah bēd parah jug chār .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, if you meet with the True Guru, the Lord shall come to dwell within your mind, and you shall find the door of salvation. ||65||

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, the Hukam, the Command of your Lord and Master, is prevailing. The intellectually confused person wanders around lost, misled by his fickle consciousness.

transliteration.text: nānak hukam varatai khasam kā mat bhavī phirah chal chit .

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: If you make friends with the self-willed manmukhs, O friend, who can you ask for peace?

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: Make friends with the Gurmukhs, and focus your consciousness on the True Guru.

section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The root of birth and death will be cut away, and then, you shall find peace, O friend. ||66||

author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਭੁਲਿਆਂ ਆਪਿ ਸਮਝਾਇਸੀ ਜਾ ਕਉ ਨਦਰਿ ਕਰੇ ॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: The Lord Himself instructs those who are misguided, when He casts His Glance of Grace.

transliteration.text: bhuliānh āp samajhāisī jā kau nadar karē .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਨਦਰੀ ਬਾਹਰੀ ਕਰਣ ਪਲਾਹ ਕਰੇ ॥੬੭॥
section: Salok Vaaran Tay Vadheek (Shaloks In Addition To The Vaars)

translation.text: O Nanak, those who are not blessed by His Glance of Grace, cry and weep and wail. ||67||

transliteration.text: nānak nadarī bāharī karan palāh karē .67.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood
